body_html: Regarding backends: I originally started writing this as a separate "function backend" but I didn't like how it was turning out. It means that users would have to call ".cudnn()" (or something similar) to swap the .backend variable. I don't think this makes sense: we should use cuDNN by default in places where it's much faster than our GEMM-based code. Users should not have to do anything special to get this behavior -- we should default to "fast".

body: Regarding backends: I originally started writing this as a separate "function backend" but I didn't like how it was turning out. It means that users would have to call ".cudnn()" (or something similar) to swap the `.backend` variable. I don't think this makes sense: we should use cuDNN by default in places where it's much faster than our GEMM-based code. Users should not have to do anything special to get this behavior -- we should default to "fast".
